sn35.7:0.3: The Interior as Impermanent in the Three Times
sn35.7:1.1: “Mendicants, the eye of the past and future is impermanent,
sn35.7:1.3: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple is not concerned with the eye of the past,
sn35.7:1.4: they don’t look forward to enjoying the eye in the future,
sn35.7:1.5: and they practice for disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding the eye in the present.
sn35.7:1.14: mind of the past and future is impermanent,
sn35.7:1.16: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple doesn’t worry about the mind of the past,
sn35.7:1.17: they don’t look forward to enjoying the mind in the future,
sn35.7:1.18: and they practice for disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding the mind in the present.”
